item.title: Stardew Valley: A Complete Guide To Panning
item.description:
There are plenty of different ways that Stardew Valley players can interact with their world. From planting crops and harvesting them to entering the mines and collecting ores, players are never short of things to do. Perhaps underutilized by Stardew Valley players, panning can be a surprisingly impactful addition to one's repertoire.

The process for unlocking panning in Stardew Valley can be a bit unclear, however, as there are a few steps that players must follow before they can reach this goal. For those looking to earn themselves a Copper Pan and begin panning for ore in the game, here's how to do so.

Updated May 14, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Many different activities in the valley will bring you useful or valuable items, and although panning takes time to unlock, you should still devote more time to it. Possible loot found in ponds in Stardew Valley will help you develop the farm faster. In addition, by upgrading the pan and enchanting it, you can get really valuable items, such as Mystery Boxes and Lucky Rings.

How to Unlock Panning in Stardew Valley

Unfortunately, panning isn't immediately available to players when they start a playthrough of Stardew Valley . There are two ways through which players can unlock panning: the Community Center and JojaMart. Both of these paths are tied to the Shimmering Boulder in the Mountain region of Stardew Valley.

Community Center

Within Stardew Valley 's Community Center, players have a handful of bundles to complete in order to earn game-altering rewards. In order to unlock panning, players need to successfully complete all six Fish Tank bundles . Once these have all been completed, the Shimmering Boulder will be destroyed, and panning will become available once players enter the Mountain region the next day and watch a cutscene with Willy.

JojaMart

Those pursuing the JojaMart storyline have a much more straightforward path. Once they have acquired a JojaMart membership, they will find the option to purchase the Panning Community Development Project . This removes the Shimmering Boulder for 20,000 gold and will also activate the cutscene the next time a player enters the Mountain region.

How to Pan in Stardew Valley

Panning is a straightforward process because Stardew Valley 's fisherman, Willy, walks players through it in a cutscene. He mentions that the player will know where to pan by the shimmering lights in the water and gives them his spare Copper Pan (though extras can be purchased from Willy for 2,500 gold). When players see those very shimmering lights while they are walking around the different regions, they need only walk over to said area and, with the Copper Pan in their active inventory, left-click on the lights.

These shimmering lights appear randomly in any river, lake, pond, on Ginger Island South, and on the Beach during the Night Market in Stardew Valley. The loot and exact location are determined at the beginning of each day. Every time a player pans, a random number of a single type of metal ore is found. On top of this, players can also find coal, a gem/mineral, or even Omni Geodes or a Lucky Ring. Daily luck as well as Food luck can increase a player's chance of finding better items, but below is a list of potential finds with their basic chances.

Ore

Percentage Chance

Bone Fragment

10% (20% with Archaeologist)

Copper Ore

36%

Iron Ore

32.3%

Gold Ore

20.8%

Iridium Ore

1%

Gems

Percentage Chance

Diamond

1.5%

Aquamarine

1%

Amethyst

1%

Emerald

1%

Ruby

1%

Topaz

1%

Other

Percentage Chance

Coal

50%

Omni Geode

28%

Earth Crystal

4.9%

Frozen Tear

4.7%

Fire Quartz

4.2%

Mystery Box

3.3% (4.4% with the Book of Mysteries )

Golden Mystery Box

3.3% (4.4% with the Book of Mysteries)

Random piece of Clothing or Furniture

0.5% - 5%

Lucky Ring

0% (3.3% with perfect daily luck)

Random Artifact

2% (7% with Archaeologist)

Random location-appropriate Fish

0% (10% with Fisher)

Panning is therefore an excellent way for players on their journey throughout the day to pick up extra ore and items. On Stardew Valley 's Ginger Island, players can also find the Fossilized Tail , as well as the Taro Tuber , through panning.

Pan Upgrades

Pan

Cost and Ingredients

Bonuses

Copper Pan

2,500g

When panning, can find 3 to 9 ores and up to 1 special item.

Steel Pan

5,000g and 5 Iron bars

When panning, can find 4 to 10 ores and up to 2 special item. Has a small chance to spawn another panning spot.

Gold Pan

10,000g and 5 Gold bars

When panning, can find 5 to 11 ores and up to 3 special items. Has a higher chance of spawning another panning spot.

Iridium Pan

25,000g and 5 Iridium bars

When panning, can find 6 to 12 ores and up to 4 special items. Has a high chance of spawning another panning spot.

Pan Enchantment

Description

Archaeologist

Odds of finding Artifact Troves increased by 4x, Artifacts by 3.5x, and Bone Fragments by 2.

Generous

Increases the maximum cap of finding non-ore items.

Fisher

There is a 10% chance you can get a location-appropriate fish.

Reaching

The maximum area of ​​effect increases.

Stardew Valley
58

item.title: Revenge of the Savage Planet: Complete Resource Farming Guide
item.description:
As the sequel to Journey to the Savage Planet, the latest open-world game, Revenge of the Savage Planet , brings back a lot of familiar stuff that’s sure to give fans a big dose of nostalgia, whether it’s meeting your robotic friend E.K.O. again or the excitement of discovering life beyond Earth. This game, however, follows fresh (and more interesting) lore, with many planets lined up to explore, packed with new alien wildlife and bosses.

As such, the planets in Revenge of the Savage Planet are stacked with resources. Some are the same as in the previous game, like Blight Bomb Plants, while others are totally new. Farming these materials is key to increasing your HP and even taking down aliens while scanning all the worlds. This guide covers how to get and use all the resources in Revenge of the Savage Planet .

How to Get All Resources in Revenge of the Savage Planet

In Revenge of the Savage Planet , you won’t just collect resources for later, like upgrading gear or crafting items; you’ll also use them directly to clear out swarms of alien creatures around you. Luckily, most of these materials can be found on almost every planet with a bit of searching. Some, like the Ferro Dispenser, are only native to orbits beyond Stellaris Prime, so you’ll be able to snag those once you get there.

All Scannable Resources in Revenge of the Savage Planet

There are 27 resources in Revenge of the Savage Planet that you’ll need to scan to add them to your Kindex. Once done, you can easily check back on them anytime. This comes in handy if you forget what a certain resource looks like when you need it for crafting weapons, stabilizers, or other gear.

Here’s how to get all the resources in the game, along with a quick overview of their purpose. Your Kindex will show 100% completion once you’ve collected them all from the game's four main planets.

No of Resources

All Resources List

How to Get / Trigger Them

Purpose

1

Ferro Dispenser

It’s filled with purple goo. Just equip the Goo Ingestor tool to extract the material from it.

Complete missions—especially "May the Fork Be With You"—and zap enemies with electricity.

2

Goo Dispenser

Grab the Goo Ingestor to harvest green goo from this plant.

Fight with aliens.

3

Ice Detonator

Just shoot it from a distance.

Freeze nearby enemies.

4

Lava Dispenser

With the Goo Ingestor tool, gather lava from it.

Burn cobwebs.

5

Blight Bomb Plant

It's a green plant that will give you the Blight Bomb recipe.

Make Blight Bombs to melt down Amber sacs.

6

Bombegranate Plant

They look like glowing mushrooms—shoot them and watch them explode. You can also grab the pieces and throw them at creatures.

Kill nearby creatures and craft Bombegrante.

7

Gelatinous Blob

Snag it in your hand and launch it at aliens.

Beat hostile wildlife.

8

Ferro Bush

Toss it at dangerous animals to give them an electric shock.

Stun foes for a bit.

9

Metallic Chunk

Pick it up using the Magnetic Fork and aim at the enemy.

Use it to damage enemies—it’s super useful for the Wormzilla fight and smashing metallic walls.

10

Goo Plant

Interact with it to make it burst with green goo.

Trap enemies.

11

Volcano Plant

Engage with the plant to spill lava.

It can be used during fights to help defeat native creatures.

12

Aluminum

Aluminum can be grabbed by busting open Aluminum rocks (press the F key) or by popping Aluminum Veins stuck to mountains. Both are green-colored and pretty easy to spot. Plus, you can grab these by taking out creatures as well.

Create Griff and Splunker 'Pacifier' Pistol and Power Hose.

13

Carbon

Take out Brainards, smash blue rocks or Carbon Veins (these are the blue ore-looking things).

Craft items like Zoot Jump Thruster and Power Hose.

14

Silicon

To get Silicon, hit those shiny yellow rocks or Silicon Veins on the ground or mountains, then collect the sparkly bits that drop. You can also kill Raccocco to snag these.

Make Power Hose.

15

Grob 'Bait' Dispenser

Grob 'Bait' Dispensers are usually found in creature-filled areas. They look like spray cans—just press the X key to grab some bait.

Wrap up the Bait and Betray Upgrade-O-Rama Challenge to learn how to use bait.

16

Orange Goo

Randomly grows out of the land; just press the 'E' or 'F' key to eat all the goo from this plant.

Increases your health and stamina.

17

Printer Slurry

It’s a liquid used for printing items. To get it, you’ll need to crack open its container by pressing the F key, then tap E to collect the Printer Slurry inside. These containers are found on each planet, usually hidden in spots like hilltops, tall plants, underwater areas, or inside jelly-like substances.

Build Power Hose.

18

Health Essence

They appear as orange beans dropped from the Vitality Plant.

Raises your health.

19

Aluminum Vein

Naturally, these are attached to mountains. You can either shoot them from the ground or jump and press the 'E' key to break them open, then collect the remains.

Obtain Aluminum.

20

Carbon Vein

Target the vein growing from the hill or mushrooms using your ranged pistol, or jump and hit it instead. After that, pick up the shiny balls.

Snag Carbon.

21

Alta Coupon Crate

Press the F or X key to open these crates.

Gives you Alta Bucks (in-game money) to complete the Alta Bucks for Alta People achievement.

22

Vitality Plant

Press the 'F' key to consume the plant.

Heal Yourself.

23

Silicon Vein

Like all Ore Veins, this one can also be found on high platforms. Destroy it using your weapon, or jump and press 'E'. Once it’s broken, gather the pieces.

Get Silicon.

24

Blight Bomb

Get the recipe by coming into contact with the Blight Bomb plant, then craft it at the 3D Printer.

Clear quests and finish creatures.

25

Bombegranate

It’s an explosive. To get it, you’ll need to unlock its recipe by checking out the Bombegranate Plant the first time you see it, then print it using the 3D Printer.

Finish a few missions and clear out swarms of creatures along the way.

26

Seed Bag

Hit the bag and gather the bouncy seeds.

Complete the Launch It Achievement.

27

Grob X

It works just like the Grob 'Bait' Dispenser.

Baiting aliens.

To check your Resource Kindex, open the Journal (press the J key) and head to the sixth section. There, you’ll find a list of all the materials you’ve discovered so far.

How to Use All Resources in Revenge of the Savage Planet

To use resources in Revenge of the Savage Planet , head to the 3D Printer (there's one at your home in Nu Florida) and print items from there. Just remember, you need the recipe for the item first, which unlocks automatically when you interact with the resources for the first time.

Here's how you can use each resource in the game:

  • Aluminium, Carbon, Silicon, and Printer Slurry are the four main ingredients used to print almost all weapons, gear, and upgrades.
  • Orange Goo, Vitality Plant, and Health Essence are used to raise your health and power.
  • Veins of Silicon, Aluminum, and Carbon are some of the main sources of these three resources.
  • Dispensers give you extract (lava, goo, and ferro) to fill your Goo Ingestor, helping you clear paths and deal with creatures.
  • Baits, on the other hand, let you make aliens fight each other.
  • Blight Bomb Plant, Bombegranate Plant, Gelatinous Blob, and Ferro Bush help you take down creature health and make throwable explosives.
  • Metallic Chunk, Goo Plant, and Volcano Plant can be used to damage local wildlife across different planets.
  • Alta Coupon Crate is the only way to farm Alta money.
  • Finally, you can use the Blight Bomb, Bombegranate, and Seed Bag to blow up or weaken aliens directly.

Your comment has not been saved

Follow

item.title: Borderlands 4: 6 Things We Know About The Kairos World
item.description:
Summary

  • Borderlands 4 takes place on Kairos, a new location with diverse regions and verticality.
  • The Timekeeper, with a synthetic army called The Order, has oppressed citizens with Bolts in their spines.
  • New additions include a dynamic weather system, Digirunners for mobility, and abandoned Silos to explore.

It’s hard to believe that Borderlands 3 was released all the way back in 2019. It just seems like such a long time ago, but the series is finally back with Borderlands 4 and a bounty of new additions. There are four new Vault Hunters, vehicles, a grappling hook, and, best of all, a new location to give old fans something different to explore.

Borderlands 4 takes place on Kairos. This location remained hidden up until events from the last game, which may be a bit of a spoiler for those who haven’t yet finished Borderlands 3 . Without going into too much detail, the artificial walls that surrounded Kairos have been broken, and players can now explore what waited behind them to their heart’s content.

All news and details were taken from Borderlands 4 ’s 2025 PAX Panel and State of Play.

6 The Timekeeper And His Minions

Beware Of The Order

The Timekeeper has been responsible for locking down the citizens of Kairos for over a thousand years. While his name implies that he can manipulate time, it’s not known what his exact powers are. What is known is that he commands a synthetic group of soldiers called The Order, which players will presumably have to fight a lot in the game.

To subjugate the citizens of Kairos, the Timekeeper put out a city-wide curfew and injected their spines with a thing called a Bolt. It controlled and tracked them for years, but after the moon incident kicking off the events of Borderlands 4 , some citizens have started taking these Bolts out. In doing so, some have died or lost their minds. This may be how the typical Psycho-based enemies will return in Borderlands 4 .

5 The Planet’s Architecture

Four Big Areas To Explore

The footage so far has shown a diverse set of areas on Kairos for players to visit. There are icy mountains, dry deserts, forests, tropical beaches, an oppressive-looking city, and more. While what each region is made of hasn’t been exactly detailed, it is known that the planet is divided into four regions: Fadefields, Terminus Range, Carcadia Burn, and Dominion.

These regions can be explored freely with next to no load times. Dominion is the aforementioned oppressive city that The Timekeeper rules out of, and Terminus Range is the icy region and the place where the most time was spent during the State of Play. New to the series is the idea of verticality, meaning that these four regions can be climbed and aren’t just flat terrains.

4 The Weather System

Bring An Umbrella

New to Borderlands 4 is a dynamic weather system that will pop up from time to time. Players don’t have to worry about these things affecting gameplay, though, unlike other games that have changing weather. For example, acid rain is not going to force players to run to cover, similar to the time-infused rain of Death Stranding .

Snow, normal rain, and dusty wind clouds could impair vision. It could become problematic to find enemies during times of extreme weather, possibly resulting in death. That’s about the only clues the developers have divulged about Kairos’ weather system, but this could all change once players start the game.

3 How Citizens Can Get Around

From Digirunners To Grappling Hooks

While the citizens of Kairos are oppressed, the technology is not completely in the dark ages. There are plenty of ways for them to get around, although this could be just for the Vault Hunters. For example, there are machines called Digirunners that people can hop onto and scoot around that look a lot like Ghosts from the Halo franchise.

This is a bit like the Catch-a-Ride vehicle systems of past games, but Digirunners are a lot more sleek and versatile for mobility. The people of Kairos hypothetically have access to grappling hooks, too, as there are plenty of grapple points in the environment. This lends to the verticality prospects that were mentioned previously.

2 There Are Abandoned Silos

Reactivate For The Crimson Resistance

One interesting detail mentioned during the State of Play is that players will find abandoned sites called Silos all over these four regions. Players can hack into these stations using their Echo-4 robot guide. Doing so will create an access point that players can then grapple onto and get some quick height to glide down from.

How these Silos tie into the history of Kairos is still a mystery. Are they like the challenge Shrines of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild ? Will they be more than hackable nodes, or will some be more involved, like dungeons in typical RPGs? Fans are just going to have to wait until September to find out.

1 The Weapon Manufacturers

Scraps Of The Past

Lastly, because Kairos was hidden from existence for a thousand years, it didn’t have complete access to the main gun manufacturers. That said, ships have crashed into the planet, giving citizens access to familiar brands like Jakobs, Maliwan, Vladof, Tediore, and Torgue, all of which are returning companies. Kairos has three distinct gun manufacturers of their own in Borderlands 4 .

The aforementioned supremacist cult, The Order, makes guns that can charge up. Ripper is a brand dedicated to making fully automatic guns, and Daedalus weapons can use different ammo types. More returning companies include Hyperion, Atlas, and COV, but they only exist as parts and not full weapon shells. The people of Kairos have learned to piece weapons together from scraps, so it’s possible to find a core gun from The Order spliced with a barrel from Hyperion or a scope from Maliwan, which is an interesting gameplay mechanic and a cool bit of lore.

8 Images
8 Images

item.title: 8 Atlus Games With The Best Companions, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Atlus games excel at creating companions with charisma, depth, and engaging personal arcs.
  • Persona 4 Golden features some of the most beloved and well-crafted characters in the genre.
  • Persona 5 Royal's Phantom Thieves shine with strong individual development and remarkable chemistry.

Recognized for creating some of the most iconic and revered JRPGs on the market, Atlus has built a loyal fan base over the past decades. The developer’s franchises stand out not only for combat or narrative but also for the way the cast is developed, making companions and other allies an essential part of each game’s experience.

Many Atlus games with the best companions manage to balance gameplay depth with emotionally engaging character development . A strong companion offers more than just combat utility, they bring charisma, a compelling backstory, and meaningful interactions that enhance immersion. These characters not only support the player but also push the story forward through personal arcs that keep the narrative consistently engaging.

8 Tokyo Mirage Sessions #FE Encore

The Companions’ Charisma Is One Of The Game’s Strongest Points

Tokyo Mirage Sessions #FE Encore
JRPG
Systems
Released
January 17, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Fantasy Violence, Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Blending narrative and gameplay elements from Shin Megami Tensei and Persona with Nintendo’s Fire Emblem , Tokyo Mirage Sessions #FE Encore follows young idols from Fortuna Entertainment who form a charismatic squad that mixes pop‑entertainment life with turn‑based battles. Each chapter highlights their personal growth, allowing them to overcome artistic insecurities and embrace their identities, which makes the storyline light, uplifting, and memorable.

Although the game never matched the popularity of other series from the publisher, its party members remain a standout feature, especially for anyone seeking a gentler adventure filled with catchy performances. Optional sidestories dig even deeper into each character, reinforcing themes of maturity and teamwork while giving the ensemble vibrant personalities and original bonds that carry the JRPG from start to finish.

7 Radiant Historia

JRPG Explores Companions Across Different Timelines

Radiant Historia
RPG
Systems
Released
November 3, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

One striking feature of Radiant Historia is its branching narrative that explores divergent outcomes for the same heroes across intersecting timelines, turning even minor choices into vital events during the game. Following Raynie, Marco, Rosch, and Aht as they travel with Agent Stocke highlights sacrifice and hope through well‑paced scenes, and the game reinforces these motifs with strategic battles that reflect each decision.

The writing becomes so engaging that characters who seem ordinary when they join Stocke’s squad soon receive nuanced arcs, political stakes, and personal revelations that invite genuine care from the player. Seeing how timeline changes reshape their attitudes, skills, and destinies encourages players to try new things, rewarding experimentation with fresh battles, hidden endings, and dramatic new scenes that deepen the overarching narrative.

6 Persona 2 Duology

Innocent Sin And Eternal Punishment Offer Enjoyable Companions

3 Images
3 Images
Persona 2: Innocent Sin
JRPG
RPG
Systems
Released
June 24, 1999
ESRB
Teen // Drug Reference, Language, Mild Blood, Sexual Themes, Simulated Gambling, Violence
Developer(s)
Atlus

Powered by

Although more traditional than modern Persona entries, the Persona 2 duology, Innocent Sin and Eternal Punishment , originally released on the PlayStation, features one of the finest casts Atlus has ever assembled, mixing sharp wit with layered backstories. Without Social Link mechanics, the writers probe every relationship through story events and optional scenes, ensuring that group chatter stays lively and that even brief exchanges push character development forward.

Both games present a darker plot than later Persona titles, delivering an emotionally dense experience packed with Jungian symbolism that tackles trauma, identity, and forgiveness in ways few JRPGs attempt. These weighty themes give every joke, argument, and quiet moment narrative impact, so even the lighthearted gags inserted between dungeons reinforce character growth and deepen the connection players feel toward the party through the entire journey.

5 Shin Megami Tensei 4

Distinct Ideals Make This One Of Atlus’s Best Games

Shin Megami Tensei IV
JRPG
Systems
Released
July 16, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

In Shin Megami Tensei 4 , protagonist Flynn travels with companions who embody clashing ideals that push the plot toward conflicting futures, giving philosophical choices concrete faces. Walter and Jonathan, avatars of Chaos and Law, constantly argue about their backgrounds and beliefs, turning their interactions into some of the game’s sharpest scenes and anchoring its moral debate for the player to consider.

While the two represent polar ideologies, Isabeau provides essential balance through her neutral and more human stance on the dilemmas the group faces during their arduous journey across a demon‑plagued world. This contrast makes Flynn’s decisions feel weighty, because every branch can radically change the story’s course, unlock unique endings, and reshape his relationships and alliances with the team forever.

4 Persona 3 Reload

Characters Intertwine With The Game’s Theme Of Mortality

Persona 3 Reload
9 /10
12
9.2 /10
Released
February 2, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
12
9.2 /10

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

One strength Atlus consistently shows is the ability to weave its cast tightly into each title’s core theme, giving every story a mirror that reflects that idea. In Persona 3 Reload the personal plots of the SEES members revolve around the mortality of human life, so Yukari, Akihiko, Mitsuru, and the others confront lingering past trauma that sometimes strains their bonds and at other times pulls them together under a shared purpose.

That realistic dynamic makes the game’s ensemble one of the strongest the developer has produced, as clashes, reconciliations, and mutual growth play out through sharply written scenes that chart their evolving relationships. Here the characters advance even without the protagonist’s direct intervention, because the narrative ensures they mature regardless of whether Social Links are completed, allowing their arcs to stand on their own merit.

3 Metaphor: ReFantazio

Heismay Is One Of The Many Remarkable Characters This Atlus Game Features

7 Images
7 Images
Metaphor: ReFantazio
10 /10
35
9.0 /10
Released
October 11, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
10 /10
35
9.0 /10

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

Drawing on the same formulas and concepts that turned the Persona series into a fan favorite, Metaphor: ReFantazio introduces a compelling cast of companions whose bonds deepen as the player interacts with them, reinforcing the adventure’s focus on relationships. This emphasis on the ties between the protagonist and the surrounding NPCs yields memorable personalities and storylines that fit the JRPG’s overarching themes with precision.

Heismay stands out as a prime example of the game’s writing, sidestepping the studio’s usual cute animal trope to portray an experienced figure burdened by profound grief. Basilio, although joining only near the finale, also receives substantial growth that strengthens the late game party and helps the title deliver some of the finest companions crafted for a modern JRPG in recent memory.

2 Persona 5 Royal

The Phantom Thieves Are Among The Best JRPG Companions Ever Created

Persona 5 Royal
10 /10
13
9.5 /10
Released
March 31, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
10 /10
13
9.5 /10

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

What sets the Phantom Thieves from Persona 5 Royal apart from other Atlus teams is the strong individual development of each member. Their stories are deeply tied to the theme of social justice, with every character confronting personal injustices as part of their growth throughout the journey.

Another factor that makes the Phantom Thieves so memorable is their striking visual design, which perfectly reflects each member’s personality and narrative arc. On top of that, the chemistry between them is remarkable, resulting in a story full of both humorous and touching moments. This dynamic helps solidify the group as one of the strongest casts ever created by Atlus for its JRPGs.

1 Persona 4 Golden

Some Of Atlus’s Best Characters Appear In This JRPG

Persona 4 Golden
10
9.0 /10
Released
December 9, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Alcohol Reference, Animated Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

Among every supporting cast Atlus has devised for its JRPGs, Persona 4 Golden boasts one of the developer’s and the genre’s most beloved and finely crafted line‑ups. From the moment they appear, the Investigation Team captivates players through camaraderie and depth, and the Social Link system invites deeper insight into each remarkable character across an intimate rural mystery that unfolds over a year of supernatural investigation.

Each member reveals internal fears and conflicts that strengthen the Investigation Team’s bonds and make them feel like genuine residents of Inaba rather than stock archetypes. A standout is Yosuke, the protagonist’s best friend, who not only rises above the game’s other companions but also secures his place as one of the most memorable characters in the entire JRPG roster.

item.title: Diablo 4: 7 Tips For Leveling & Farming In Season 8
item.description:
Summary

  • Season 8 of Diablo 4 has new seasonal events and boss powers, requiring a focus on Lair Bosses for efficient late-game farming.
  • Apparition Incursions offer early leveling opportunities with decent experience gain and access to new boss powers in Season 8.
  • To level up fast in Season 8, players should engage in Helltides, Undercity events, and Strongholds while focusing on targeted farming in Kurast Undercity.

Diablo 4 's eighth season is underway, and as well as the new seasonal activities and boss powers, Season 8 comes with a rebalancing of the game's higher difficulties, especially where endgame bosses are concerned. New seasonal events mean new ways to gain experience and gear, and the new boss powers present players with a new way to customize their builds, in a similar vein to Season 7's witchcraft powers.

The difficulty rebalance and the new focus on Lair Bosses, however, mean that there are some changes to late-game farming and what the most efficient methods to progress are. On top of that, while the 0-60 leveling curve remains mostly the same, the push through Torment 1-4 is now more elongated, requiring a longer grind to get full unique and ancestral equipment loadouts. With all the changes and new events, these are the best tips for leveling and farming in Diablo 4 Season 8 .

7 Apparition Incursions

Seasonal Event

Best Rewards

  • Boss Powers
  • Spectral Ash

Apparition Incursions are Season 8's new seasonal event. They're not the most involved event Diablo 4 has seen, with players basically rushing to kill mini-bosses and elites in a designated area until a final boss spawns, followed by a spectral version of Belial. Players should use these events as their early way of leveling, though, as they'll receive decent experience and also get access to some of the early boss powers available in Season 8.

These boss powers can be a big power boost if players select the right synergies for their build, and some of the main powers are enough to carry early-game damage on their own. Players can equip one main power and three support powers at a time, and they should make sure to collect and equip these as soon as possible. Players will also get Spectral Ash from these events to advance their seasonal reputation, but that's just one of the many ways to get seasonal rep in Season 8.

6 Getting To Level 60 Fast

Helltides, Undercity, And Nahantu Strongholds

Best Rewards

  • Skill Points
  • Legendary Gear
  • Materials

Once players have a few boss powers and early levels available, the best way to progress quickly is to do the Helltide events that spawn regularly across the map and unlock the Kurast Undercity as soon as possible (if available). If players have the Vessel of Hatred expansion, then once they hit level 50, they can complete all the Strongholds in Nahantu, and this should take them up to max level 60.

Following this leveling strategy can take players from a fresh character to max level in a few hours, and it should also get them the basic legendary gear and aspects they need to build a functional character for the first Torment difficulty level.

5 Helltides And Infernal Hordes

Still Good For Gear And Materials

Best Rewards

  • Gem Fragments/Obducite
  • Legendary Gear
  • Experience

Helltides are still a good way for players to level quickly and gear up, as they have been in previous seasons. Once players get to the first level of Torment difficulty, they can start using the Infernal Horde Compasses that occasionally drop from Helltides and the Blood Maiden.

These are even more rewarding and are still among the best sources of Obducite for masterworking gear, as well as gem fragments. Slaying the hordes of enemies and completing the Helltide will reward a decent amount of Paragon experience, too.

4 Kurast Undercity

Target Farming With Tributes

Best Rewards

  • Lair Boss Keys
  • Obducite
  • Runes
  • Potential Mythic Uniques

The Kurast Undercity is a timed trial run available in Kurast, where players burn tributes to guarantee a chance at specific rewards upon completion. These dungeon runs are only available to players with the Vessel of Hatred DLC, but they're one of the best ways to farm Lair Boss Keys this Season, along with some other useful rewards.

Rewards are dependent on the Tribute that players use to access the Undercity. A Tribute of Titans, for example, will result in Lair Boss Keys dropping on completion of a run. There are Tributes that guarantee Rune drops (though legendary runes are still very hard to obtain), there are Tributes that guarantee Obducite for masterworking, and there are Unique Tributes that can give players a chance at unique and even mythic unique items as potential rewards.

3 Push The Pit

Paragon Experience Farming

Best Rewards

  • Unlock Torment Difficulties
  • Paragon Experience
  • Glyph Upgrades

The Pit of the Artificer in Cerrigar is still central to progressing through Diablo 4 's Torment difficulty levels in Season 8. Players will need to complete Pit level 10 before they can access Torment 1 and start farming endgame activities and items. The Pit isn't just a grind to increase difficulty, though.

As players need to progress through runs quickly and get kills to advance, they'll accumulate a lot of experience by pushing higher pit tiers. This makes the Pit one of the most efficient experience grinds, even at higher Paragon levels. Completing Pit runs within the time limit is also the only way players can upgrade Glyphs to socket into their Paragon Boards, which offer crucial power boosts for higher tier characters.

2 Tackling The Boss Ladder

Reworked Reward System And Harder Bosses

Best Rewards

  • Unique/Ancestral/Mythic gear
  • Boss Powers
  • Higher Tier Lair Boss Keys

Some of the biggest changes in Season 8 are the rework of the Torment difficulty tiers, the resulting changes to the balancing of the Lair Boss fights, and the changes to how farming these bosses actually works. Unlike previous seasons, players can summon and fight these bosses without a cost. However, beating the bosses themselves only unlocks their associated boss power (in Torment 1 or higher). Players now need keys to open a Lair Boss Hoard that spawns once the boss is dead in order to get their associated unique items and other rewards.

If players fight the lower-tier bosses, The Beast in the Ice, Varshan, Grigoire, or Urivar ( Vessel of Hatred only), then the Hoards will also drop Keys for the higher-tier boss hoards of Andariel, Duriel, and The Harbinger of Hatred ( Vessel of Hatred only). Belial is at the top of the boss ladder, but the keys for his hoard only drop from the random encounter with Belial that can happen after beating another Lair Boss. As well as farming the Lair Bosses themselves for uniques and boss keys, players should make use of the Tribute of Titans in the Kurast Undercity to generate a lot of boss keys for repeated farming.

1 Additional Tips For Getting Mythic Uniques

Top Tier Items

Best Rewards

  • Resplendent Spark

For players who want to farm for Mythic Uniques in Season 8, beating the higher-tier Lair Bosses in the highest Torment tier possible and opening Hoards is the best strategy. There are also Unique Tributes that can rarely drop from sources like world bosses that give players a chance of getting Mythic Uniques at the end of an Undercity run. On top of this, there are two ways players can get Resplendent Sparks (which are needed to craft Mythic Uniques) without increasing the Torment difficulty above level 1.

The first way is to beat Lilith in Torment 1 or higher. While Lilith is counted in the boss ladder, as she has her own boss power to unlock, she isn't included in the key rotation like the other bosses. Instead, the reward for beating Lilith is a Resplendent Spark, but her redesigned fight is now even tougher. Players can also get a Resplendent Spark from completing their seasonal reputation levels by earning enough Spectral Ash, which will happen relatively quickly with enough Lair Boss Farming.
